required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of a Plant-based Ingredient on Glucose Response
clinical_study.official_title: An Exploratory Study of a Plant-based Ingredient for Reducing the Post-prandial Blood Glucose Response in Healthy Indian Adults, When Administered With a Meal

brief_summary.textblock: The study is designed to determine the extent to which a plant-based ingredient is able to modulate blood glucose response when administered with a meal.

primary_outcome.measure: Positive incremental post-prandial blood glucose area unde the curve

secondary_outcome.measure: Positive incremental post-prandial blood glucose area under the curve

secondary_outcome.description: GE50% (time to empty 50% of the gastric content) will be determined with paracetamol

other_outcome.description: peak plasma glucose - baseline plasma glucose

arm_group.description: No Plant-based ingredient added to a starchy meal

arm_group.description: Plant-based ingredient in low dose added to starchy meal
No Plant-based ingredient added to starchy meal and side dish

arm_group.description: Plant-based ingredient in medium dose added to starchy meal and side dish
